body.p:
Campbellsburge Ky.
25th Octr AD 1863
Govener Thomas E. Bramlette
Dear sir

I inclose you Mr Matthew McCollister pertions for to obtain your remittance of his fine of $250 -- I have known McCollister for upwards of thirty three years, and know him to be all that his pittition represents him to be. I have been his Family Physician for more than Twenty five years -- his wife has been confined to her bed & House more than one third of that time, with incuriable disease- he is poor and barryly makes out to live with all of his industry & frugallaty- and to have the above amount to pay would compell him to sell a part of his Plantation in the Hills of Trimble County- When Mr C Scott & my self
were in Frankfort two weeks agoe we paid Mr J. L. Scott Prosacuting Attry -- Fifty dollars in full of his Fee & connecting with the fine his Fee was about $75.00 and believeing it would be opprisive he took $50- which we advanced -- The subscribers to the Pettition cirtafying the respectabillaty of the witnesses to the conversation which induced McCollister to assault Horton are all good & True men: which I will refer you to Mr Thomas Rodman as he is well acquainted with the most of them. -- and for my character I refer you to Gen Jno M Harlan, A G Hodges & L. Rodman -- If you remitt the fine please direct it to McCollister or my self at Campbellsburge Henry Cty. Ky.

I remain as ever your
devoted personal & Political
Friend
James Gorlee M. D.
